channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2023080940
item.description:
Report X-2023080940

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T03:11:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was in our sort when It was called out to our team. Once this package went down the slide to get loaded in a trailer the manager called over our QA team to get it into our hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: lid was unscrewed. Please apply tape over lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA took this package into the hazmat cage and started working on the damaged package.

item.title: Report E-2023090100
item.description:
Report E-2023090100

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit due to improper blocking and bracing and that 5 cases of paint (un1263) had been crushed by other freight and had damaged all 20 metal inner one gallon cans and had released 20 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023081048
item.description:
Report E-2023081048

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: SALINA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 55 gallon drum of paraffin dispersant (un1993) had been punctured by a nail and had released 32 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023080332
item.description:
Report X-2023080332

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023080332: SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A LEAKING HAZMAT. DMP RESPONDED BY SENDING A RESPONDER WITH FULL SPILL CART AND PPE. RESPONDER ARRIVED AND CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED PROPER PROTOCALL AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. X-2023080333: SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A HAZMAT LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP SENT RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART TO THE LEAKER. RESPONDER ARRIVED AND CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE ON HOW BEST TO RESPOND. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE, THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE LEAKER FOLLOWING THE APPRIATE STEPS. THE RESPONDER BROUGHT THE LEAKER BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.
